thread.title: Did Kyle Schwarber pull a Babe Ruth in win over Cardinals?
thread.title_full: Did Kyle Schwarber pull a Babe Ruth in win over Cardinals?

title: Did Kyle Schwarber pull a Babe Ruth in win over Cardinals?
text:
Did Kyle Schwarber pull a Babe Ruth in win over Cardinals? Slugger helps Cubs to win Published 6:15 AM PDT Oct 14, 2015 Photos Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images 
As baseball legend has it, Babe Ruth gestured to the left-center field bleachers just before he hit his called shot, one of the greatest home runs of all time, during Game 3 of the 1932 World Series. 
On Tuesday night, Chicago Cubs slugger Kyle Schwarber might not have pointed at the bleachers, but he confided with teammate Dexter Fowler beforehand that he would "hit a home run" off St. Louis Cardinals reliever Kevin Siegrist. 
Schwarber, speaking at the post-game press conference, said that Fowler responded "Well do it." 
In his next at-bat, Schwarber launched a scoreboard-clearing shot out of Wrigley Field onto Sheffield Avenue, giving the Cubs an insurance run and a 6-4 lead. The Cubs won the NLDS series 3-1 with the eventual victory. 
The Sheffield Shot, anyone?
